item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Get Sun & Moon Crown Eevee (Can It Be Shiny?)
item.description:
Pokemon GO 's highly anticipated GO Fest 2024 event is giving players a chance to catch some really special costumed Pokemon. Out of several of them, players are quite curious to learn more about catching Sun & Moon Crown Eevee.

While Eevee isn't a particularly hard Pokemon to get in Pokemon GO , these special event versions are much sought by the community since it is not quite possible to get them after the event. Here is how to get Sun & Moon Crown Eevee and its shiny variant.

How To Get Sun & Moon Crown Eevee in Pokemon GO

Players will be able to get Sun & Moon crown Eevee only in unique habitats around Nanakita Park as part of the GO Fest 2024: Sendai, Japan event. Depending on the habitat, the type of crown Eevee will be wearing will vary. Here are all the habitats and the respective spawns.

Pokemon

Pokemon

Moon Crown Eevee

  • Mountain Brook
  • Star Parade

Sun Crown Eevee

  • Sky Arena
  • Lake Garden

Unlike the GO Fest Global event which is time-based, these habitats will only be focused around Nanakita Park , so players will need to explore the surrounding areas in order to find the different habitat spawns. This can be a bit tricky, but, to begin with, players shouldn't have much trouble finding each of these habitats, considering that the area isn't that large,. Usually, these are tied to coordinates, so once players find a habitat, they should try to look for the Pokemon in the vicinity to increase their chances of getting a particular form of Eevee.

The usual tricks work here, as players will be able to use Lure Modules and Incense to further boost the spawn rates of the Pokemon and increase their chances of getting a Sun or Moon Crown Eevee. Considering that Eevee is a Normal-type Pokemon, players don't have many options apart from using the regular Lure Modules, as they specialized don't work for Normal-type Pokemon.

How To Get Shiny Sun & Moon Crown Eevee

For players wondering if they can get a shiny variant of the Sun and Moon Crown Eevee, the good news is that these Pokemon are available in their rare form . However, the odds remain quite low, as there is essentially a 1 in 500 chance to get a shiny Eevee in the wild. While the developers have not revealed anything about the shiny boosts, these events usually have a better-than-regular chance of getting a shiny Pokemon, so players should definitely try looking for a shiny Eevee for a while.

item.title: Anime Defenders: How to Farm Gems
item.description:
As befits the tower defense genre, in Anime Defenders , your main strength is your units. Each of them has unique skills and stats, and to get new ones, you will need plenty of Gems.

Gems are one of the main currencies in this Roblox title. They are required for various activities, including rolling new characters and traits. For this reason, earning money in Anime Defenders can be quite challenging. Fortunately, by using several methods, players can streamline the process and acquire large amounts of Gems with relative ease. Here are some of the best ways to farm Gems in Anime Defenders .

Best Ways to Farm Gems in Anime Defenders

Of course, the easiest way to get Gems in Anime Defenders is to buy them with Robux. This method will bring you as much currency as you want. But if you wish to avoid spending real money and still want to get the best Anime Defenders units or traits, you can use each of the methods below to farm Gems.

Use Anime Defenders Codes

Since Anime Defenders is a Roblox game, it features codes, and using these codes can earn you various rewards in just a few clicks. On top of that, most of them will grant you valuable Gems. These codes can expire, however, so players must be fast if they wish to make the most of them.

Complete Quests

Log in to Anime Defenders every day to gain access to various quests. All of them are divided into Daily, Weekly, and Endless. And as you can guess, their refresh times differ. Because of this, you should always do the Daily quests first and then move on to the rest. By completing them all, you can quickly farm Gems in Anime Defenders .

Visit AFK Zone

As the name suggests, AFK Zone is where players can permanently farm Anime Defenders currencies. You just need to enter this zone and relax to start receiving rewards.

It is essential to note that the drop rate of Gems in this mode is relatively low, but if you have already completed all the available quests, it is a great way to earn extra currency.

Play Infinite Mode

The final method is Infinite Mode. In it, you will have to fight waves of enemies until they kill you. Although it requires skill, you can get Gems as a reward for extended survival. Moreover, this is an excellent place to practice using your units.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14: Every Deep Dungeon (& How To Unlock Them)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock Palace Of The Dead In Final Fantasy 14
  • How To Unlock Heaven-On-High In Final Fantasy 14
  • How To Unlock Eureka Orthos In Final Fantasy 14

Long-standing MMORPGs like Final Fantasy 14 have no shortage of content available thanks to years of continued updates adding new dungeons, raids, and character upgrades for players to enjoy. One issue that the genre often struggles with, however, is ensuring the relevance and longevity of legacy content as players achieve stronger gear and obtain power far beyond what was originally available. One answer Final Fantasy 14 has come up with is the Deep Dungeon.

Deep Dungeons are a special category of instanced content that borrows elements from the popular roguelike genre, featuring randomly generated floor layouts, permadeath within the dungeon for parties that wipe on later floors, and an independent leveling system that resets every run. Players that are able to thrive in these dungeons will find themselves rewarded with unique weapon rewards and have the potential to earn rare and lucrative items from random drops, as well as access to an alternative leveling method and the ability to test out a job's higher-level abilities early.

How To Unlock Palace Of The Dead In Final Fantasy 14

Palace of the Dead is the first Deep Dungeon added to Final Fantasy 14 in the Heavensward expansion, available to players as early as level 17. Players can unlock Palace of the Dead by completing the level 17 Main Scenario Quest " Into a Copper Hell, " followed by the level 17 sidequest " The House That Death Built " in New Gridania (X:12, Y:13). Once unlocked, the Deep Dungeon can be entered by speaking with the Wood Wailer Expeditionary Captain in South Shroud (X:25, Y:21). After players have successfully completed floor 50 of the Palace of the Dead, a new sidequest, "What Lies Beneath," is available from the Expeditionary Captain, unlocking floors 51 to 200.

Rewards from the Palace of the Dead include the Padjal and Kinna series of weapons, as well as Gelmorran Potsherds, which can be exchanged for exclusive minions and mounts like the Disembodied Head, and a chance to obtain the rare Black Pegasus mount from Gold-trimmed Sacks hidden throughout the dungeon in floors 151 and beyond. Players that successfully complete all 200 floors will be randomly rewarded with either a Firecrest or Glass Pumpkin, which can be exchanged with E-Una-Kotor in South Shroud (X:25, Y:21) for corresponding accessories or housing decorations.

How To Unlock Heaven-On-High In Final Fantasy 14

Heaven-on-High is the second Deep Dungeon introduced in the Stormblood expansion. In order to access this dungeon, players will need to have completed floor 50 of the Palace of the Dead, as well as the level 63 Main Scenario Quest "Tide Goes in, Imperials Go Out."

Once these requirements are met, Heaven-on-High can be unlocked from the level 61 sidequest " Knocking on Heaven's Door " in The Ruby Sea (X:6, Y:12). Heaven-on-High can then be entered by speaking to Hamakaze in The Ruby Sea (X:6, Y:12). Like Palace of the Dead, players will need to complete a sidequest to unlock the latter floors of this Deep Dungeon, with "On the Shoulders of Giants" becoming available in The Ruby Sea (X:21, Y:9) after players complete floor 30. Unlike Palace of the Dead, players must be at least level 61 in order to enter, as creating new save data for Heaven-on-High begins players at level 61.

Rewards from Heaven-on-High are similar to those from Palace of the Dead, including Empyrean weapons, Empyrean Potsherds that can be exchanged for the exclusive sweat emote and frilled dragon minion, and the rare Dodo mount (rarely obtained from Platinum-haloed Sacks that are hidden from floors 71 and beyond). Those that are able to reach floor 100 will be rewarded with an Empyrean Reliquary that can be exchanged with the Confederate Custodian in The Ruby Sea (X:21, Y:9) for accessories or housing decoration. These accessories are also part of the Dressed for Heaven achievement , requiring players to speak with the Confederate Custodian with all four Empyrean accessories equipped, rewarding players with the Juedi mount and the True Hero title.

How To Unlock Eureka Orthos In Final Fantasy 14

Eureka Orthos is the most recent Deep Dungeon at the time of writing, being added in the Endwalker expansion. To unlock this dungeon, players will need to have completed floor 50 of the Palace of the Dead and complete the level 90 Main Scenario Quest, "Endwalker." After meeting both these requirements, the level 81 sidequest "Delve into Myth" becomes available in Mor Dhona (X:22, Y:8), unlocking Eureka Orthos upon completion. The Deep Dungeon can be entered by speaking with Khatun at the Eight Sentinels in Mor Dhona (X:35, Y:19) and requires a minimum level of 81 . Once players have completed floor 30 of the dungeon, they'll have to complete the "Rage Extinguished" sidequest in Mor Dhona (X:35, Y:19) to unlock floors 31 to 100.

Rewards from Eureka Orthos include the Orthos and Enaretos series of weapons; Orthos Aetherpool Fragments, which can be exchanged with the Synthesis Node in Mor Dhona (X:35, Y:19) for the exclusive Eureka Orthos Framer's Kit; and the exclusive Orthos Craklaw, which can randomly be obtained from Gold-tinged Sacks hidden throughout floors 71 and beyond. Additionally, players that complete floor 100 will be rewarded with an Orthos Tomestone, which can be exchanged with the Synthesis Node for one of four accessories or a housing decoration item.Obtaining all four Enaretos accessories and speaking with Koh Rabntah in Mor Dhona (X:35, Y:19) will reward players with the Aeturna mount .

item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Get Heat Rotom (Can It Be Shiny?)
item.description:
The GO Fest 2024 marks the debut of Heat Rotom in Pokemon GO , a form that has been missing in the game all this time. Fans are curious to learn how to catch this variant of the Pokemon, as well as whether a shiny version is available in the game or not.

The GO Fest is one of the most anticipated events of the year in Pokemon GO as it not only adds a plethora of new Pokemon to the game, but also gives fans a chance to get some exciting rewards along the way. For players looking to add another form of Rotom to their collection, here is what they need to know about Heat Rotom in Pokemon GO and whether it has a shiny variant .

How To Get Heat Rotom In Pokemon GO

Heat Rotom is one of the many Pokemon that is debuting as part of the GO Fest 2024 event. However, unlike some of the other Pokemon that will be available in the game, Heat Rotom requires a special method to catch it. Heat Rotom is not available in the wild, and the only way players can catch it is through the GO Snapshot feature . While many players are already aware of how it works, it can be a bit tricky to do it. Here is how to use the GO Snapshot photobomb feature to catch Heat Rotom.

  • Tap on any Pokemon and press the Camera button to open Snapshot mode. This applies to both wild Pokemon and your own Pokemon.
  • Take a picture of the Pokemon.
  • Check the picture you have taken to see if Heat Rotom has photobombed it.
  • If Heat Rotom has appeared in the picture, head back to the in-game map to find Heat Rotom there.
  • If not, repeat the process until you get heat Rotom in the snapshot.

Can Heat Rotom Be Shiny In Pokemon GO?

Niantic has not announced whether the shiny variant of Heat Rotom will be available in the game or not. As per player reports, there haven't been any encounters that confirm that the shiny variant was also released as part of the event.

This is not the first time that Niantic has not included a shiny variant of a Pokemon along with its debut, so it is not really surprising to see the developers opting for this approach instead. For the record, the other available Pokemon variants do not have shiny versions in the game as well. The only exception is the regular version of the Pokemon, which can be caught in its shiny form.

item.title: Killing Floor 2: Best Berserker Weapons, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Berserkers in Killing Floor 2 have a variety of powerful melee weapons to choose from, each with unique strengths and weaknesses.
  • The Bone Crusher is a heavy, defensive weapon, ideal for players who prefer a tank-style of play, providing both protection and damage.
  • The Static Strikers are among the best and fastest Berserker weapons, allowing for double the attack speed and high damage output.

Killing Floor 2 is a wave-based zombie shooter in which players must face off against increasingly difficult enemies, all the while upgrading their arsenal with a unique range of powerful weapons and skills. It can make a great alternative to Call of Duty Zombies while still essentially following the same style of gameplay.

The Berserker class is one of the more specialized classes in the game, focusing on melee damage and increased health in order to hold off and carve through enemies. Berserkers will gain bonuses to melee attacks and have a wide range of devastating weapons to choose from. From old classics like katanas and greatswords to modified futuristic weapons with special charging effects, Berserkers have plenty of choice when it comes to cutting down Zeds.

8 Katana

This Classic Sword Is An Ideal Starting Point For Berserkers

  • Cost: 850 Dosh
  • Carry Weight: 4 KG

The Katana is one of the earliest weapons Berserkers will be able to access from the Trader. This light weapon puts an emphasis on speed rather than power, though when upgraded, it can be just as devastating as many of the much heavier melee weapons while still retaining its fast swing speed.

Overall, the Katana is an excellent and versatile weapon that leaves plenty of carry room for other weapons such as drones or firearms. While it may not always be the best handling weapon, with some swings missing their target or falling short, it can do plenty of damage when it connects and can take out some lower-tier enemies in a single hit.

7 Zweihander

A Decent Two-Handed Sword To Deal With Lower Zeds

  • Cost: 1300 Dosh
  • Carry Weight: 7 KG

The Zweihander is a large, two-handed longsword that prioritizes power and damage output over swing speed or defense. While the weapon can be used to block incoming attacks, it is best used when advancing, as this will provide bonus damage.

The Zweihander can be unlocked by players who possess either Killing Floor 2 Digital Deluxe or Chivalry: Medieval Warfare . Much like other DLC items in the game, it is possible to gain access to them simply by playing in the same match as another player who owns them.

6 Eviscerator

A Unique Cutting Weapon That Gives The Berserker Class Some Ranged Options

  • Cost: 1600 Dosh
  • Carry Weight: 9 KG

The Eviscerator is an excellent dual-purpose weapon that can be used to either bash opponents or fire off saw blades in order to dismember them from a distance. The projectile damage from saw blades is significant, and the melee attack can always be used to follow up on any surviving Zeds.

Although the Eviscerator has a relatively low ammo capacity, it should still be enough to get through several mid-stage waves, and the saw blades can often take out several opponents at once if they are lined up correctly.

5 Blood Sickle

A Powerful Two-Handed Scythe That Is Ideal For Mid-Tier Enemies

  • Cost: 1500 Dosh
  • Carry Weight: 7 KG

The Blood Sickle is a tier 4 Berserker weapon available to players who have or are playing alongside a player who has the Armory Season Pass 2. This slashing weapon can be used to take out multiple enemies at once, particularly with the use of its alternative double-sweep attack.

While neither the fastest nor the strongest melee weapon in the game, it is still very solid, particularly against mid-tier enemies and even in the later stages of a game. It may struggle up against bosses, however, but fortunately, due to its lower carry weight, it can be used in conjunction with other items.

4 Bone Crusher

A Powerful Combination Capable Of Taking Down Most Enemies

  • Cost: 1600 Dosh
  • Carry Weight: 8 KG

The Bone Crusher is a club and shield combo that provides Berserkers with a great option for defense while still dishing out high amounts of damage. When upgraded, players can also use a shield bash attack of up to 175 Damage.

Overall, this weapon provides a great choice for players who prefer more of a heavier 'tank' style of play, such as blocking certain chokepoints and being less mobile. While the swinging attacks are slower than many of its rival weapons, the Bone Crusher is still a powerful weapon, and the shield it provides is certainly noteworthy.

3 Static Strikers

One Of The Best And Fastest Berserker Weapons In The Game

  • Cost: 1600 Dosh
  • Carry Weight: 7 KG

Static Strikers are among the best melee weapons in the game, and unlike most melee weapons, players will have one in each hand, leading to double the attack speed and overall damage output. When upgraded, they can be supremely effective and can even take down harder enemies and bosses.

While the standard attacks rely more on speed than strength, they can usually take out low-to-mid tier Zeds with a couple of punches. For larger Zeds, a special electronic attack can be used, which will apply additional shock damage.

2 ION Thruster

A Powerful Sword Capable Of Causing Mass Burning Damage

  • Cost: 2000 Dosh
  • Carry Weight: 8 KG

The ION Thruster is a powerful heated sword that will be available to players who either own or play with someone who owns the Armory Season Pass. The ION Thruster has several attacks, including a special charged attack that burns enemies.

A relatively fast swing speed combined with high damage make it supremely effective for wiping out hordes of even mid-tier Zeds such as Sirens and Husks. Overall, it is a great choice in the later waves when enemies become progressively more advanced.

1 Battle Axe

This Heavy Axe Deals Out More Damage Than Any Other Melee Weapon

  • Cost: 2000 Dosh
  • Carry Weight: 10 KG

Dealing out 250 Damage with a standard swing, the Battle Axe is one of the strongest weapons in Killing Floor 2 in terms of damage output. As a result, the Battle Axe is capable of taking out multiple smaller Zeds in one hit, and it can even take down larger enemies like Scrakes or Fleshpounds single-handedly with a barrage of hits.

While this comes at a cost of slow attack speed and a high carry weight, it is an even trade-off considering just how much force this weapon is able to generate. While it may not be suited to players who prefer a faster, more agile build, the Battle Axe is easily one of the most devastating weapons in the Berserker's arsenal.
